summary: The "Single Supervisory Mechanism" (SSM) is a pivotal component of the EU banking union, established to ensure the stability and integrity of the European banking sector. It centralizes the supervision of significant banks within the Eurozone, enhancing regulatory coherence and mitigating systemic risks. The SSM operates under the auspices of the European Central Bank (ECB), which conducts comprehensive assessments and enforces compliance with EU banking regulations. As a redirect to the preferred term "EU banking union," the SSM exemplifies the EU's commitment to a unified regulatory framework aimed at fostering financial stability and protecting depositors across member states.
